detaileddescription.para: Traces intermediate hops between host and destination

parameterdescription.para: Command line options similar to that of traceroute utility in a single string
Pointer to struct where results are stored

simplesect.para: EXIT_SUCCESS on successful / -ve value (depending on the type of error) on failure
This API will allocate a buffer for storing route hops which is pointed by 'pxRouteHops' member of 'TraceRouteResp_D'. It is the duty of the caller to free this.

briefdescription.para: SCAPI gets next MAC address API.

detaileddescription.para:
API that generates a MAC address for an interface by properly incrementing the base MAC address without any conflicts (with MAC addresses of other interfaces)
pcIfname
Interface name for which a MAC address should be generated
pcMac
Pointer to a buffer where generated MAC address will be stored
EXIT_SUCCESS on successful / -ve value (depending on the type of error) on failure

briefdescription.para: SCAPI remove next MAC address API.

detaileddescription.para: API that removes the entry of generated MAC address for an interface from the config file

parameterdescription.para: Interface name of the entry to deleted

simplesect.para: EXIT_SUCCESS on successful / -ve value (depending on the type of error) on failure

detaileddescription.para: API to fork a new shell and carry out a given operation and collect exit status of the child process (of the shell)

parameterdescription.para: Command to be executed by the shell
Flag that determines if the command is blocking or non blocking
Exit status of the child process (of the shell)

simplesect.para: EXIT_SUCCESS on successful / -ve value (depending on the type of error) on failure
1. Spawn daemons in non-blocking mode.

2. Spawn utilities in blocking mode. For every utility which is executed in non-blocking, it is assumed that parent handles the SIGCHLD signal and does wait() or waitpid() in that signal handler. If not, then the child will stay as a zombie until parent exits

3. If int pointed by pnChildExitStatus is greater than 128, then it possibly means that the executed process (from shell) exited due to an unhandled signal. It is expected that the user programs spawned by this API doesn't do exit() with a value greater than or equal to 128

briefdescription.para: SCAPI manages the platform-specific parts of the system. It offers both command line interfaces and equivalent IOCTLs to configure the Linux system.
